segments.text: I notice the boy is stretching so far to reach those cookies, and that stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, hand out, like she’s waiting for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that dish, it’s almost funny how unaware she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how ridiculous this whole situation is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing out, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kids are going to get away with it, at least for now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the light comes in through the window makes everything look so peaceful, but it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy will actually fall or if he’ll manage to keep his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing is like a cartoon, just waiting for the punchline.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away—it’s too amusing.
segments.speaker: PAR
